sn47.41:1: At Sāvatthī. "Bhikkhus, dwell with your minds well established in the four establishments of mindfulness. Do not let the Deathless be lost on you.[n.79]Mā vo amataṁ panassa.Spkoffers no help, but I takepanassato be an aorist ofpanassati.Woodward has apparently understood it aspan’ assaand translates, "But let not that be to you the Deathless" (KS 5:6). Butpanahere would be syntactically out of place.
